verses.text: 指摘耶路撒冷的罪這叛逆、污穢、欺壓人的城有禍了！

words.note: Lit. 'point out and pick faults'
Often refers to moral or spiritual impurity
Lit. 'people-oppressing'
An exclamation of impending judgment

verses.text: 她不聽話，也不受管教；她不倚靠耶和華，也不親近她的 神。

words.note: Lit. 'listen to words'
Lit. 'receive discipline'
The original text may contain a preceding space for reverence.

verses.text: 城中的領袖都是咆哮的獅子，城中的審判官是夜間的豺狼，甚麼都不留到早晨。

words.note: Often used metaphorically for predatory or evil people

verses.text: 城中的先知都是輕浮詭詐的人；城中的祭司褻瀆聖物，違犯律法。
耶和華在城中是公義的，決不行不義的事；他每日早晨都顯明公正，永不止息。不公義的人卻不知廉恥。

words.note: Lit. 'forever not stop rest'
Refers to a sense of honor and shame.

verses.text: 我耶和華已經剪除列國，他們的城樓被毀；我已經使他們的街道荒涼，以致杳無人跡；他們的城市荒廢，以致無人存留，無人居住。

words.note: Indicates an action completed.
Often used in biblical contexts referring to divine judgment or destruction.
A common biblical term referring to gentile nations.
Indicates an action completed.

words.definition: so that, with the result that

words.note: An idiom describing complete desolation.

words.definition: so that, with the result that

verses.text: 我說：「她定要敬畏我，接受管教。」這樣，她的住所必不會照著我原定對她的懲罰被剪除。可是他們殷勤行惡，敗壞了自己一切所作的。

words.note: A key biblical concept for having reverence and awe towards God.
In biblical context, refers to divine discipline and training.
Often used in biblical contexts referring to divine judgment or destruction.
Here implying diligent in doing evil.
A common phrase in the Bible describing moral transgression.
The particle '所' forms a nominal phrase 'that which is done'.

verses.text: 耶路撒冷必蒙拯救耶和華說：「因此，你們要等候我，等候我起來指證（按照《馬索拉文本》，「指證」作「擄掠」;現參照《七十士譯本》翻譯）的日子，我已經決定集合萬邦，召聚列國，把我的盛怒，就是我的一切烈怒，都傾倒在他們身上；因為全地都必被我的妒火吞滅。

words.note: Often implies receiving favor or blessing from a higher power.
A core theological term for salvation.
Often implies patient, hopeful waiting for divine action.
Often implies patient, hopeful waiting for divine action.
Here, refers to God rising to provide evidence or execute judgment.
The authoritative Hebrew and Aramaic text of the Jewish Bible.
Common in biblical narratives of warfare and conquest.
The Koine Greek translation of the Hebrew Bible.
Indicates an action completed.
A common biblical term for all gentile nations or peoples.
Often used for God's calling or gathering of people/nations.
A common biblical term referring to gentile nations.
Introduces the object of a verb, placing it before the verb.
Used to describe strong, often divine, anger or indignation.
Used for clarification or emphasis.
Similar to '盛怒', emphasizing the intensity of anger, often divine.
Lit. 'on the body', often used idiomatically for 'upon someone'.
Refers to the entire world, often with theological significance.
Figurative language for God's intense jealousy/zeal for His honor.
A powerful verb often used in biblical judgment or destruction contexts.

verses.text: 那時我要使萬民有潔淨的嘴唇，他們全都可以呼求耶和華的名，同心合意事奉耶和華。

words.note: A common biblical term referring to all the inhabitants of the earth.
Often refers to ritual purity or spiritual cleanliness in the Bible.
Specifically used for calling on God's name for help or worship.
In biblical context, often refers to God's character, authority, or presence.
An idiom emphasizing unity and accord, significant in biblical fellowship.
Specifically implies serving a deity or superior; worship.

verses.text: 敬拜我的人，就是我所分散的人，必從古實河外而來，給我獻上禮物。

words.note: A fundamental term for religious worship.
Used for clarification or emphasis.
Forms a nominal phrase preceding a verb, often referring to 'that which is...'
Refers to a river in the region of Cush (ancient Ethiopia/Nubia).
Specifically implies presenting an offering to God or a superior.

verses.text: 到了那日，你必不因你背叛我所作的一切感到羞愧，因為那時我必從你中間除掉那些自高自大的人。在我的聖山上，你必不再高傲。

words.note: Indicates a passive or emphasizes action.
Refers to Mount Zion, representing God's dwelling.

verses.text: 但我要在你中間留下謙虛卑微的人；他們必投靠耶和華的名。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.

verses.text: 以色列的餘民必不再行不義，也必不說謊；他們的口裡也沒有詭詐的舌頭。他們吃喝躺臥，沒有人驚嚇他們。」

words.note: Name of a nation and people.
Refers to a surviving part of a community.

verses.text: 歡樂之歌錫安的居民（「居民」原文作「女子」）哪！你們要高歌。以色列啊！你們要歡呼。耶路撒冷的居民哪！你們要滿心歡喜快樂。

words.note: Literary equivalent of '的'.
A biblical hill in Jerusalem, often symbolic for God's holy city.
Name of a nation and people.
Ancient capital of Israel.

verses.text: 耶和華已經除去你們的刑罰，趕走你們的仇敵。以色列的王，耶和華在你們中間，你們必不再懼怕災禍。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
Name of a nation and people.
The Hebrew name for God.

verses.text: 到了那日，必有人對耶路撒冷說：「錫安哪！不要懼怕；你的手不要下垂。

words.note: Refers to a specific future or past day of significance.
Figurative: do not lose courage.

verses.text: 耶和華你的 神在你中間，他是施行拯救的大能者，必因你歡欣快樂，必默然愛你，而且必因你喜樂歡唱。」

words.note: The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Often rendered with a preceding space in older Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 「那些屬你，為了切慕大會而憂愁的人，他們擔當了羞辱；我必招聚他們。

words.note: Refers to religious gatherings or festivals.

verses.text: 看哪！那時我必對付一切苦待你的人；我必拯救那些瘸腿的，聚集那些被趕散的；在全地受羞辱的，我必使他們得稱讚，有名聲。

words.note: Used to draw attention, similar to 'lo' or 'behold'.

verses.text: 那時我必把你們領回，那時我必把你們齊集；我使你們被擄的人歸回的時候，必在你們眼前，叫你們在地上的萬民中得稱讚，有名聲。」這是耶和華說的。

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase: 'the time of your return'.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Forms a nominal phrase: 'what the LORD said'.
